Promoting free trade globally is not an approach I support. Each country has its own unique characteristics and diversity that should be respected. I am not convinced that global free trade would take into account these significant differences. Thus, I stand by my view that we should not endorse global free trade.

The concept of equal income distribution may conflict with the values of personal effort and economic freedom. Instead, the emphasis could be on enhancing opportunities for all.
